Josh Whitley - State Farm Agent
May 28 at 4:31 PM ¬∑

Good things happen when neighbors come together. Last week I mentioned I would be supporting the BakPak Pals program through Communities in Schools of Robeson County. Today, I made a $1,000 donation to help provide students with nutritional meal and snack options during the summer. BakPak Pals expects to provide bags to over 200 students each week this summer in Lumberton, Maxton, and Red Springs. The program began in 2011, and guidance counselors identify students who may not have consistent access to adequate food on weekends during the school year. Now, the program has been extended during the summer months as well. Typically, a BakPak consists of two juices, two breakfast items, two main meal items, a fruit cup, pudding cup, and snacks. Thank you to CIS of Robeson for working to eliminate hunger as one of the major obstacles facing many of our students!

Angelica Chavis McIntyre is with Joe Osman and Brock Chavis at Townsend Middle.
April 27, 2017 at 11:47 AM ¬∑ Maxton, NC ¬∑

Today I was able to share with the 7th and 8th graders at Townsend Middle School what it is like to be a lawyer, as well as an Assistant District Attorney, along with my colleague, Joe Osman. These kids were great amateur attorneys! They enjoyed solving the case about the "accidental murder!" We loved hearing their questions, as well as what they thought a lawyers job was. Thank you to the faculty and staff for encouraging these students to think about their future, as well as the employees of Communities In Schools, for organizing this event! Great job, BreAnna Daba Branch and Dencie Lambdin!
